short_description: This function converts the binary weight vector into (attributeid,weight) pairs.
long_description: This function reads a linear/non-linear SVM model from model table, then convert  the model to a format of (attributeid, weight) pairs, where weight is the measurement of the attribute in each one of the classes.

input_tables.name: input
input_tables.rDescription: It should be the training dataset, otherwise the result may be incomplete.
input_tables.description: It should be the training dataset, otherwise the result may be incomplete.

input_tables.name: model
input_tables.rDescription: The model table generated by SparseSVMTrainer.
input_tables.description: The model table generated by SparseSVMTrainer.

argument_clauses.name: AttributeColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Input table columns that contain the attributes of the test samples. Attribute columns must be numeric (int, real, bigint, smallint, or float).
argument_clauses.description: Input table columns that contain the attributes of the test samples. Attribute columns must be numeric (int, real, bigint, smallint, or float).

argument_clauses.name: Summary
argument_clauses.rDescription: If true, the output contains only summary information of the model. If false, the output contains the weight of each attribute in the model. The default value is false.
argument_clauses.description: If true, the output contains only summary information of the model. If false, the output contains the weight of each attribute in the model. The default value is false.
